New Records: Rohit Sharma scored 92 off 41 balls, a significant achievement in the match.
Arshdeep Singh took crucial wickets including Matthew Wade and David Warner, contributing to India's victory.
Key Match Events: India set Australia a target of 206 runs to win.
Arshdeep Singh took a key catch to dismiss Mitchell Marsh, a pivotal moment in the match.
Rohit Sharma's 92 was the highest score in the match.
Pre-Game Insights: Australia won the toss and chose to bowl first.
Analysts predicted a close game between the two teams.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma was named Player of the Match for his outstanding performance.
India's victory set up their semi-final clash against England.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was interrupted by rain but play resumed shortly after.
The high score of 206 set by India was notable.
Others: The catch by Axar Patel was highlighted as one of the tournament's best.
The performance of bowlers like Jasprit Bumrah and Arshdeep Singh was crucial for India.
